🚫 Don’t park within 10 metres of an intersection without traffic lights.
🔶 A yellow line on the kerb = no stopping at all.
🧠 No stopping means not even to drop someone off.
🕓 If a time range is on a sign, it applies every day unless otherwise stated.
🅿️ '1P' means 1 hour from the time you park — not from when the ranger arrives.
🚨 Clearways are tow zones, even if you’re in the car.
🧾 Always check both ends of the street — signs change mid-block.
🐦 Bird poo or broken meters don’t excuse overtime parking.
⚖️ Leave at least 1 metre clear from driveways.
🛑 Stay 20m back from pedestrian crossings — even with no sign.
📦 Loading Zones are for commercial vehicles actively loading/unloading.
🚚 If you're in a private car, you can only stop for 2 minutes — to drop/pick up goods or passengers.
🕒 Time limits in Loading Zones are strictly enforced — often 15 mins max.
🚫 You can’t 'wait your turn' in a loading zone — it’s for immediate action only.
🔄 Loading Zones don’t override other signs — time limits and restrictions still apply.
♿️ Only vehicles displaying a valid permit may park in a disability space.
🔁 Some areas allow double the posted time for disability permit holders — check local rules.
🅿️ A disability permit doesn’t exempt you from no-stopping zones, clearways or illegal spaces.
👮‍♀️ Misusing a disability permit (e.g., using a relative’s) can result in large fines or legal action.
📷 Rangers often check permits with photo ID or QR codes.
🚕 Taxi Zones are for registered taxis only — not rideshare vehicles.
🚗 Private cars can’t stop in taxi zones even if the spot is free.
🚐 Bus zones are only for buses — minibuses and shuttles aren’t allowed without approval.
🚫 You can’t park on verges or nature strips in most NSW councils — even partially.
🏖️ In many beach suburbs, parking meters run until 10PM — check the fine print.
🚫 Don’t assume 'after hours' = free parking — tourist zones often extend paid time.
🧭 Some councils (like Byron or Shoalhaven) have resident-only zones during peak periods.
🐾 Many dog beach access zones have specific parking rules nearby — check signage.
🛍️ Rangers may not patrol private centres, but centres can issue their own fines (e.g. Wilson, Secure).
🕰️ Time limits (e.g. 2P) in centre car parks are tracked by cameras, not chalking anymore.
📸 Some centres now use number plate scanning to auto-fine overstayers.
📋 Read small signs at entries — your use is usually governed by contract law, not RMS rules.
🛴 Don't park scooters or bikes on ramps, paths or nature strips — it can result in a fine.
🚷 Verge parking = illegal in most councils — even with two wheels off the road.
🧯 Fire hydrants require at least 1 metre clearance — often overlooked.
🧊 Parking over grated drains or pit covers may be fined as obstruction in some areas.
📍 Multi-sign zones: the most restrictive sign always applies.
📱 Using an app like ParkAware doesn’t override the law or signage — always double-check.
🗺️ Rules vary by LGA: what’s legal in Sydney may not be in Shoalhaven.
🧠 If unsure, take a photo of the sign — fines are appealable if signage is unclear.
